instructions.text:
BBB4M

Unit 1 Mini-Assessment

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four +/-

Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • A3. demonstrate an understanding of how international business and economic activities increase the interdependence of nations.

  • A3.1 identify the types of international businesses

  • A3.2 describe ways in which international business activity develops interdependence among nations 

  • A3.3 describe the effects of barriers and obstacles to international business activity

  • A3.4 explain how and why Canada’s major international business relationships have evolved over time.

Instructions:

  1. You will create a concept map about international business, trade and economy. You need to explore the topics and concepts discussed in Lesson 1.1 and 1.2. 

  2. In your concept map, you can add a short description about the term/s in your concept map.

  3. Make a presentation showing your concept map. 

  4. Be creative! Design your presentation using Canva or Prezi. You can add pictures. 

  5. Once you’re done, upload your concept map presentation in your assigned course folder.

Rubric

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of international business, trade and economy?

Showed little understanding with almost no detail about the lesson.

Showed some understanding with little detail about the lesson.

Showed good and acceptably detailed understanding about the lesson.

Showed an excellent and detailed understanding about the lesson.

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical thinking and creativity when you answered the given task?

Answers given showed creativity with limited effectiveness or appropriateness to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with some effectiveness and were somewhat appropriate to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with considerable effectiveness and were good answers to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with high degree effectiveness and were excellent answers to the questions.

 

Demonstrated little critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated some critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated good critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated excellent critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Communication: How well did you communicate your thinking with your concept map, and how well did you organize your information in your assignment?

Did not communicate thinking well with little detail and very little clarity.

Communicated thinking with some detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking well with good detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking with excellent detail and clarity.

 

Information was organized poorly, was hard to follow, and/or had details missing.

Information was somewhat organized and most details were present.

Information was well organized and all details were present.

Information was expertly organized and extra information was given.

Application: How well did you apply your learning in your output?

Output was very poorly presented and does not give impact

Output is somewhat well presented and has little impact.

Output is well presented and has a good impact.

Output is extremely well and has a great impact.

 

Made little connection between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made some connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made good connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made excellent connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.




Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments

instructions.text:
BBB4M

Unit 1 Summative

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-




K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%

Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • A3. demonstrate an understanding of how international business and economic activities increase the interdependence of nations.

  • A3.1 identify the types of international businesses

  • A3.2 describe ways in which international business activity develops interdependence among nations 

  • A3.3 describe the effects of barriers and obstacles to international business activity

  • A3.4 explain how and why Canada’s major international business relationships have evolved over time.





Instructions:

  1. You will do some of the preliminary work of being an importer. You will research products, calculate tariffs, and design a business card for your import company.

  2. You have $100,000 to buy products from around the world. Which ones you import will be up to you. 

  3. Requirements:

    1. Make sure you have read & understood BBB4M Calculating Taxes, Tariffs and Duty.

    2. Name your import business.

    3. Select at least four different products to import.

    4. For each item, you must show

      1. A picture of the product.

      2. A brief description of the product.

      3. The Supplier of your product.

      4. The country of origin.

      5. The Harmonized Code for calculating the duty on your product.

      6. The tariff rate.

      7. The cost of your order. (Including Units, Shipping charges, Taxes, & Duty )

    5. Create a business card, including your name & fictitious contact information. (Please show the front & back.)

    6. Show the total cost of your imports and business cards. (Not to exceed $100,000)

  4. It can be a PowerPoint presentation, a pdf, or a word document.

  5. Submit your work to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  6. Apply feedback from Paper to your work.

  7. Submit the Paper Feedback for additioinal marks.

  8. Keep a copy of your work in your course folder.

Rubric 

Student Name:

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of the given task by describing ways on how Canadian Trade functions.

Fails to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the given task when discussing how to trade with Canada functions.

Attempts to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the given task when discussing how to trade with Canada functions.

A good demonstration of knowledge and understanding of the given task when discussing how to trade with Canada functions.

An excellent demonstration of knowledge and understanding of the given task when discussing how to trade with Canada functions.

Thinking: How well did you analyze the trade relationship of two countries?

Analyses the trade relationship of two countries with limited effectiveness and limited evidence

Analyses the trade relationship of two countries with some effectiveness and some evidence 

Analyses the trade relationship of two countries with considerable effectiveness and considerable evidence 

Analyses the trade relationship of two countries with a high degree of effectiveness and thorough evidence 

Communication: How well did you communicate the trade relationship of two countries?

Did not show good communication when presenting the trade relationship between the two countries.

Shows limited communication when presenting the trade relationship between two countries.

Shows good communication when presenting the trade relationship between two countries.

Shows excellent communication when presenting the trade relationship between two countries.

Application: How well did you apply your comprehension of Taxes, Tariffs and Duties?

Doesn’t show an application of their comprehension of Canada's Taxes, Tariffs and Duties.

Shows limited application of their comprehension of Canada's Taxes, Tariffs and Duties.

Shows good application of their comprehension of Canada's Taxes, Tariffs and Duties.

Shows excellent application of their comprehension of Canada's Taxes, Tariffs and Duties.



Overall Percentage

Teacher’s Comment

instructions.text:
BBB4M

Country Portfolio Project Assignment

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%

Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • C1. analyse the ways in which cultural factors influence international business methods and operations;

  • C4. evaluate the factors currently affecting the international competitiveness of Canadian businesses.

  • C1.1 describe the modifications made to goods and services to adapt them to the cultures of other countries

  • C4.2 explain how Canada’s cultural diversity contributes to its competitive success in international business

Instructions:

Imagine you are stepping off a plane in Abu Dhabi, U.A.E. Would you know the history of that city and nation? Would you know which religions are practiced there? Would you feel comfortable there? Would you be able to avoid offending people while conducting business?

Whenever a firm does business with individuals or companies in other countries, its representatives must be aware of such cultural issues. This is because the cultures of both trading partners can affect every aspect of a business relationship.

It is important to explore the various aspects of culture. Understanding culture is the foundation, or basis, of understanding every other aspect of conducting international business. 

  1. For this task you will create a country profile. It can be hand drawn or digitally made.

  2. Follow the outline below, draw arrows from each of the indicated body parts and complete the required information below. 

  1. Each of these sections tells us about the culture that exists in your country. 

  2. It is your job to conduct research and tell the readers about your nation.

  3. Make it colorful and visually appealing.

  4. Submit your work to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  5. Apply feedback from Paper to your work.

  6. Submit the Paper Feedback for additional marks.

  7. Refer to the rubric below on how you will be graded.

  8. Keep a copy of your work into your course folder.



Rubric

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of the country’s culture you have chosen?

Showed little understanding with almost no detail about the lesson.

Showed some understanding with little detail about the lesson.

Showed good and acceptably detailed understanding about the lesson.

Showed an excellent and detailed understanding about the lesson.

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical thinking and creativity when you answered the given task?

Answers given showed creativity with limited effectiveness or appropriateness to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with some effectiveness and were somewhat appropriate to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with considerable effectiveness and were good answers to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with high degree effectiveness and were excellent answers to the questions.

 

Demonstrated little critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated some critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated good critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated excellent critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Communication: How well did you communicate your thinking when asked by your teacher, and how well did you organize your information in your assignment?

Did not communicate thinking well with little detail and very little clarity.

Communicated thinking with some detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking well with good detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking with excellent detail and clarity.

 

Information was organized poorly, was hard to follow, and/or had details missing.

Information was somewhat organized and most details were present.

Information was well organized and all details were present.

Information was expertly organized and extra information was given.

Application: How well did you apply your learning in your output?

Output was very poorly presented and does not give impact

Output is somewhat well presented and has little impact.

Output is well presented and has a good impact.

Output is extremely well and has a great impact.

 

Made little connection between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made some connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made good connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.

Made excellent connections between the lesson discussed and life learning.




Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments

instructions.text:
BBB4M

UNIT 2 SUMMATIVE

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%

Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • C1. analyse the ways in which cultural factors influence international business methods and operations;

  • C4. evaluate the factors currently affecting the international competitiveness of Canadian businesses.

  • C1.1 describe the modifications made to goods and services to adapt them to the cultures of other countries

  • C4.2 explain how Canada’s cultural diversity contributes to its competitive success in international business

Instructions:

Instructions:

  1. Choose one country except for Canada.

  2. Imagine that you are a citizen of that country and own a business of your choice.

  3. You want to take your business to Canada.

  4. Research how you will be able to enter the Canadian market.

  5. Create a presentation that will convince your co-owners to expand your business.

  6. Your outline should include

    1. Company History

    2. Target Market

    3. Requirements to enter the Canadian market

    4. Regulations that your company should follow

      1. Things that you will need to consider joining the market.

      2. Benefits you may gain in entering the Canadian market

      3. Conclusion: You should state why entering the Canadian market will be more beneficial than staying where you are.

  7. Submit your work to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  8. Apply feedback from Paper to your work.

  9. Submit the Paper Feedback for additional marks.

  10. Refer to the Rubric below on how you will be graded.

  11. Keep a copy of your work in your course folder.







Rubric

<50

Level 1 (50-59)

Level 2 (60-69)

Level 3 (70-79)

Level 4 (80-100)

Knowledge

-understanding of questions and information from written description (accurate interpretation of details)

-able to follow directions

-ability to work within time constraints (time management during class time given)

-understands purpose of project

-demonstrates limited understanding of relevant concepts

- incomplete, not relevant  or lack of salient details

-some sense of project requirements

-demonstrates clear understanding of concepts and expectations of project

-written/pictorial explanations are nearly complete, and relevant (but the level of detail is inconsistent or some details are plagiarized

-use of time is good with minor exceptions

-clear understanding of project’s purpose

written/pictorial explanations are accurate, relevant and detailed with minor exceptions and no plagiarism

-excellent time management

-understands purpose of project with minor exceptions

-demonstrates high degree of understanding of relevant concepts of project

written/pictorial explanations are accurate, relevant and detailed and no plagiarism

-understands purpose of project

Communication

-included all required information including bibliography/list of sources

-attention is given to vocabulary, grammar, and spelling

-provides many detailed examples relevant to concept with many charts or pictures

-consistently uses appropriate vocabulary,-accurate spelling and grammar

Application

Thinking

instructions.text:
BBB4M

NGO and CSR Questionnaire Assignment

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • B3. assess the effects of current trends in global business activity and economic conditions.

  • B3.1 explain, drawing on information from a variety of sources, including the Internet, how Canadian and international companies, industries, and markets are being affected by increased global business activity;

  • B3.2 identify and analyse international business trends and their influences on companies, industries, and career opportunities in the global economy

  • B3.3 assess, considering factors such as markets, financing, and labour, how trends in the globAL marketplace have changed the ways in which an individual might run a business

  • B3.4 explain how globalization creates the need for standardization of products, services, and processes

Instructions:

  1. Answer the questions below.

  2. Do additional research as required to answer the questions.

  3. Submit the assignment to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  4. Apply feedback from Paper to the  additional support.

  5. Submit the Paper Feedback for additional marks.

  6. Keep a copy of your work in your course folder.

Questions:

  1. What is an NGO? Give five examples. 

  2. Explain how WE Charity has helped youth around the world.

  3. What is the purpose of Fairtrade Labelling Organizations International?

  4. What are the benefits of fair trade?

  5. What products qualify for Fairtrade labelling?

  6. Describe how Ten Thousand Villages works.

  7. What is the ISO? What are the ISO 9000, ISO 14000, and ISO 27000 series?

  8. What are the advantages of ISO certification?

  9. Answer all the questions in writing. 

Rubric

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of your research about NGO?

Showed little understanding with almost no detail about the research

Showed some understanding with little detail about the research

Showed good and acceptably detailed understanding about the research

Showed an excellent and detailed understanding about the research

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical thinking and creativity when you answered the given task?

Answers given showed creativity with limited effectiveness or appropriateness to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with some effectiveness and were somewhat appropriate to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with considerable effectiveness and were good answers to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with high degree effectiveness and were excellent answers to the questions.

 

Demonstrated little critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated some critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated good critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated excellent critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Communication: How well did you communicate your thinking when asked by your teacher, and how well did you organize your information in your assignment?

Did not communicate thinking well with little detail and very little clarity.

Communicated thinking with some detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking well with good detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking with excellent detail and clarity.

 

Information was organized poorly, was hard to follow, and/or had details missing.

Information was somewhat organized and most details were present.

Information was well organized and all details were present.

Information was expertly organized and extra information was given.

Application: How well did you apply your learning in your output?

Output was very poorly presented and does not give impact

Output is somewhat well presented and has little impact.

Output is well presented and has a good impact.

Output is extremely well and has a great impact.

instructions.text:
BBB4M

UNIT 3 Summative

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • B3. assess the effects of current trends in global business activity and economic conditions.

  • B3.1 explain, drawing on information from a variety of sources, including the Internet, how Canadian and international companies, industries, and markets are being affected by increased global business activity;

  • B3.2 identify and analyse international business trends and their influences on companies, industries, and career opportunities in the global economy

  • B3.3 assess, considering factors such as markets, financing, and labour, how trends in the globaL marketplace have changed the ways in which an individual might run a business

  • B3.4 explain how globalization creates the need for standardization of products, services, and processes



Instructions:

  1. Research a famous or known product or service in your country.

  2. Make a short presentation or bulleted marketing plans to lead your business to a higher and more extensive global competition.

  3. Twist your chosen product to be marketed in Asian countries.

  4. Your research and paragraphs must include cultural, demographic, geographic, or any factors affecting your target consumers to patronize your product or service to be Asians’ favourite.

  5. Below is the template you can use:

  • Case Study Background

    • A general overview of the product or service you chose and information you gathered from your research.

  • Aim of Research

    • What is the central goal or purpose of the research? What research topics, questions, or problems does the project intend to address, and why?

    • Who are your target consumers?

  • Marketing Construct

  • Product/Service

    • What changes to your product or service will you make to gain Asian customers?

    • Include a picture of your product or service.

  • Price

    • What will be your pricing strategy to capture customer value?

  • Place

    • In what country will you start to expand your product or service and why?

    • How will you deliver your product or service to that country?

  • Promotion

    • How will you plan to promote your product or service?

    • What advertising channels will you use to connect to more consumers?

    • Include your slogan

  • Conclusion

    • Summary of the strategies you will undertake to introduce your product/service to Asian countries and how it will be the Asian’s favourite.

  1. Submit your work to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  2. Apply feedback from Paper to your work.

  3. Submit the Paper Feedback for additional marks.

  4. Refer to the rubric below on how you will be graded.

  5. Keep a copy of your work in your course folder.



Rubric

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: How well did you demonstrate your knowledge and understanding of your research about CSR?

Showed little understanding with almost no detail about the research

Showed some understanding with little detail about the research

Showed good and acceptably detailed understanding about the research

Showed an excellent and detailed understanding about the research

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical thinking and creativity when you answered the given task?

Answers given showed creativity with limited effectiveness or appropriateness to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with some effectiveness and were somewhat appropriate to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with considerable effectiveness and were good answers to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with high degree effectiveness and were excellent answers to the questions.

 

Demonstrated little critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated some critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated good critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated excellent critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

instructions.text:
BBB4M

Supply Chain Questionnaire

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment OF Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%

Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • D3. demonstrate an understanding of the logistics of, and challenges associated with, distribution to local, national, and international markets.

  • D3.1 compare the logistics of delivering a product to a local, a national, and an international market;

  • D3.2 describe the key factors that influence the ways in which a company may deliver its product to an international market;

  • D3.3 compare the advantages and disadvantages of different modes of transportation for distributing a product to different world markets

  • D3.4 identify, drawing on a variety of sources, including the Internet, information to facilitate the import/export process

Instructions:

  1. Answer all questions in writing.

  2. Do additional research as required to answer the questions

  3. Keep a copy of your work into your course folder.

Questions:

  1. What are six supply chain issues that might affect international shipments?

  2. What is a single-window system?

  3. What does optimization mean?

  4. What does digitalization do for the supply chain?

  5. What does CBSA stand for and what does it do?

  6. What does DFATD stand for and what does it do?

  7. What assistance does the Canadian Trade Commissioner Service provide?

  8. What does ISED stand for and what does it do?

  9. What is the role of the Canada Business Network?

  10. What is the Canadian Trade Index?

  11. What is the role of a customs broker?

instructions.text:
BBB4M

UNIT 4 Summative

Purpose of Assessment: Assessment of Learning

Method of Assessment: KTCA Four Level +/-



K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Ontario Curriculum Expectations

  • D2. compare the approaches taken by various companies to market their products internationally

  • D2.1 identify market-entry strategies used by companies for entering foreign markets;

  • D2.2 describe, on the basis of online investigation, the ways in which information and communication technology

  • D2.3 compare marketing approaches taken by companies in different foreign markets 

Instructions:

  1. You are the logistics manager at a Canadian clothing company.

  2. The marketing department has analyzed the need for a new product. The design team has designed the clothing. Your job is to have it made and delivered to retailers (in Canada).

  3. Prepare a Google slideshow to send to the product manager. The product manager must approve of your logistical choices before executing your distribution plan.

  4. Brainstorm the raw materials used to make a pair of new Yoga shoes. (Polyester, cotton, leather, rubber, etc.)

  5. Research the countries that are the top three producers of the material(s).

  6. Research the countries that are the top three manufacturers of shoes.

  7. Choose your manufacturing country based on the distance it is away from the sources of raw materials.

  8. Choose the countries that will be the top three consumers of your products.

  9. Outline your distribution plan for the Canadian market. Consider all transportation requirements (from the raw materials >> manufacturer >> retailer)

  10. Refer to the rubric below on how you will be graded.

  11. Submit your work to Paper for review to get feedback from a live tutor.

  12. Apply feedback from Paper to your work.

  13. Submit the Paper Feedback for additional marks.

  14. Keep a copy of your work in your course folder.



Rubrics

K: 25%

T: 25%

C: 25%

A: 25%



Student Name:

 

Level 1: 50%-59%

Level 2: 60%-69%

Level 3: 70%-79%

Level 4: 80%-100%

Grade

Knowledge: 

  • Understanding of questions and information from written description (accurate interpretation of details)

  • Able to follow directions

  • Ability to work within time constraints (time management during class time given)

  • Understands purpose of project

Demonstrates limited understanding of relevant concepts

Demonstrates some understanding of relevant concepts of required elements

Demonstrates considerable understanding of relevant concepts of project

Demonstrates high degree of understanding of relevant concepts of project

 

Thinking: How well did you demonstrate your critical thinking and creativity when you answered the given task?

  • Logical sequencing of information, fluid read

  • Analysis well thought out

  • Evidence of careful planning

Answers given showed creativity with limited effectiveness or appropriateness to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with some effectiveness and were somewhat appropriate to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with considerable effectiveness and were good answers to the questions.

Answers given showed creativity with high degree effectiveness and were excellent answers to the questions.

 

Demonstrated little critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated some critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated good critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Demonstrated excellent critical thinking in how you answered the given tasks.

Communication: How well did you communicate your thinking when asked by your teacher, and how well did you organize your information in your assignment?

Did not communicate thinking well with little detail and very little clarity.

Communicated thinking with some detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking well with good detail and clarity.

Communicated thinking with excellent detail and clarity.

 

Information was organized poorly, was hard to follow, and/or had details missing.

Information was somewhat organized and most details were present.

Information was well organized and all details were present.

Information was expertly organized and extra information was given.

Application: How well did you apply your learning in your output?

Output was very poorly presented and does not give impact

Output is somewhat well presented and has little impact.

Output is well presented and has a good impact.

Output is extremely well and has a great impact.

 

Made little connection between the lesson discussed and distribution plan

Made some connections between the lesson discussed and distribution plan

Made good connections between the lesson discussed and distribution plan

Made excellent connections between the lesson discussed and distribution plan




Overall Percentage

Teacher Comments
